Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Tranexamic Acid Dosing in Chinese Cardiac Surgery Patients

Trial_Design.evidence: participants aged 18-70 years undergoing cardiac surgery with CPB were randomly assigned

Participants.evidence: participants aged 18-70 years undergoing cardiac surgery with CPB

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned to high-dose (30 mg/kg bolus, 16 mg/kg/h maintenance, 2 mg/kg prime, n=7) or low-dose (10 mg/kg bolus, 2 mg/kg/h maintenance, 1 mg/kg prime, n=9) TXA groups

Objective.evidence: aimed to develop a population pharmacokinetic (PK) model of tranexamic acid (TXA) in Chinese patients undergoing cardiac surgery with cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB) to inform individualized dosing strategies

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the PK parameters, measured perioperatively

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence with allocation concealment by a blinded research coordinator

Blinding.evidence: allocation concealment by a blinded research coordinator

Number_Randomised.evidence: n=7) or low-dose (10 mg/kg bolus, 2 mg/kg/h maintenance, 1 mg/kg prime, n=9)

Result_Outcome.evidence: Population estimates for clearance (CL1), volume of the central compartment (V1), diffusional clearance (CL2), and volume of peripheral compartment (V2) were 4.7 L/h, 4.9 L, 17.0 L/h, and 11.1 L, respectively
